FuncDef:
The car cross-board command implement rate limiting for inter-board trunk packets and inter-board packets on a dumb terminal.
The undo car cross-board command restores the default rate.
By default, inter-board trunk packets and inter-board packets on a dumb terminal are forwarded at the default rate.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the CBS.
The value is an integer ranging from 1000 to 19200000, in bytes. The default value is 7680000 bytes.

Specifies the CIR.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 100000, in kbit/s. The default value is 10240 kbit/s.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Excessive inter-board trunk packets and inter-board packets on a dumb terminal can cause downstream traffic congestion and reduce CPU efficiency. To implement rate limiting for inter-board trunk packets and inter-board packets on a dumb terminal, run the car cross-board command.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
